text: Leon Ware (February 16, 1940 - February 23, 2017) was an American music artist, songwriter and composer. He was born in Detroit, Michigan. Besides a solo career as a performer, Ware was best known for producing hits for other artists including Michael Jackson, Quincy Jones, Maxwell, Minnie Riperton and Marvin Gaye. He was known for co-producing the latter's album and the song I Want You.
